analysis: The run failed because the environment is missing the networkx package and the installed version of network_diffusion is incompatible (it lacks the required MultiSpreading class) needed by epidemic.py.
rationale: The error trace shows a ModuleNotFoundError for networkx and an ImportError when attempting to import MultiSpreading from network_diffusion. Additionally, a web search did not locate an alternative version of the package, indicating an environmental dependency issue rather than a coding mistake.
recommended_actions: Update the requirements and/or environment configuration to include the missing dependency ‘networkx’. This can be done by adding networkx to the requirements.txt or by specifying it in the env_override.json.

Review the version of the network_diffusion package and modify the environment/installation instructions to install the correct version that includes the MultiSpreading (and PropagationModel) classes. If an upstream version is available, specify it; otherwise, consider vendor-ing the correct dependency if possible.
Verify the installation instructions in the Readme and adjust the environment (using fix-package env/input overrides if needed) so that all dependencies are correctly resolved and installable.
In epidemic.py, add minimal diagnostic logging to confirm that the proper dependency versions are installed before proceeding.
next_steps: Create or update /Users/ronan/Developer/agent-debug/fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-8807709 with overlays/patches/input/env overrides. Do NOT run the HAL debugger or any rerun commands as part of this step. Do a careful self-review and produce a complete fix package in one pass.
inspector_suggested_next_steps: The coding agent must re-run the HAL debugger after these fixes are applied to validate that the dependency issues have been resolved and that epidemic.py executes successfully.
